author: iSazonov
body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

PowerShell Core is distributed not only as self-contained (with .Net Core Runtime dlls) but also as runtime-depended (without .Net Core Runtime dlls). This last one implies that PowerShell 7.0 can run on different .Net Core Runtime versions according to the major-verison roll-forward principle. This means that PowerShell 7.0 will work on any 3.\*.\* version including minor and patch updates. This may be important for troubleshooting and bug reporting.

Suggestion is to add .Net Core Runtime version information in $PSVersionTable.

# Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

```powershell
 [System.Runtime.InteropServices.RuntimeInformation]::FrameworkDescription

.NET Core 3.1.1
```
title: Add .Net Core Runtime version information in $PSVersionTable
